artefact.overview: You must register with your local Health and Social Care Trust (HSCT) if you want to become a childminder or provide day care services in Northern Ireland
artefact.licence_short_description: You must register with your local Health and Social Care Trust (HSCT) if you want to become a childminder or provide day care services in Northern Ireland.
artefact.licence_overview:
$!Contact your local Health and Social Care Trust (HSCT) to apply for registration as a childminder, or to provide day care services.$!

You must register if you're paid to look after children who:

* are under 12 
* you’re not related to
* for more than 2 hours a day
* in a private home

All the adults living or working at the home where you’re based must also register.

You don’t have to register to do babysitting.

%If you want to provide any type of day care service for children under 12, you must register even if you’re not charging any money. This includes playschemes, out of school clubs or creches.%

##How to apply

s1. [Download the guide to childminder and daycare registration (PDF, 53KB)](http://www.dhsspsni.gov.uk/cog8-guide-to-help-with-registration-children-order-childminding-daycare.pdf "Download the guide to childminder and daycare registration"){:rel="external"}
s2. [Contact your local HSCT](http://www.hscni.net/index.php?link=services "Contact details for local Health and Social Care Trusts"){:rel="external"} for a registration form.

It is free to register.

##What happens next

Once you've submitted your application the HSCT will: 

* check your references
* carry out checks on you with your doctor, your council and the [Criminal Records Bureau (CRB)](/crb-criminal-records-bureau-check "Getting a Criminal Records Bureau check"), 
* do checks on anyone else who will be living or working at the home
* inspect the home 

###Getting your registration
If you're approved, you will receive a certificate that shows you're a registered childminder. This usually takes between 2 and 3 months.

##Displaying your certificate
You must keep your certificate of registration - or a copy of it - where it can be easily seen. 

##Fines and penalties
If you don’t register as a childminder, you can be fined £5,000, sent to prison, or both.

*[HSCT]: Health and Social Care Trust
